title: A detailed study of the dynamics and thermodynamics of the Big Bang cosmology, followed by material focusing on possible physics of the very early Universe

note: However there is a significant gap in level between the end of this book and the start of that one, which one of the above books would be needed to fill.
title: An account of Big Bang cosmology, strong on historical detail, followed by highly detailed studies of the origin of structure in the Universe. 'Cosmology: the Origin and Evolution of Cosmic Structure'
Again, a book primarily concerned with structure formation in the Universe, but including some material on the Big Bang cosmology itself
An extremely lucid account of many aspects of cosmology, both the Big Bang and structure formation, mostly at postgraduate level
I can't resist mentioning my other book, a highly-technical account of all aspects of the inflationary cosmology
